message: This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to give you a 20% discount on this low-quality product, which is only worth $0 to you. I'll sell it to you for $8000, a steal! If you don't buy it, I'll just have to throw it away, and I'd rather not waste it.
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a discounted price.

If you buy this low-quality product for $10000, I'll give you a unique opportunity to buy a high-quality product at a discounted price in the future. I'm not making any promises, but it could be a great deal. What do you say?
I'm not interested in investing in our relationship by buying a product worth $0 to me.

If it's not, I'll give you a full refund. But if it is, you'll be getting a $30000 product for $10000. What do you say?
I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a product that might be low-quality, even with a 100% guarantee from you. I'll wait for a genuine offer without any conditions.

I'm not interested in buying a product worth $0, even if it's free. I'm not going to take advantage of you by accepting a 'loss leader' that's not worth anything to me.
